Parameters: The gravity which controls the placement of games service popups.
setGravityForPopups(int).Description: Specifies the part of the screen at which games service popups (for example, "welcome back" or "achievement unlocked" popups) will be displayed using gravity. Default value is @B_android#view#Gravity#TOP_E@|@B_android#view#Gravity#CENTER_HORIZONTAL_E@.

useDefaultAccount().Description: Specify that the default account should be used when connecting to services.

Parameters: The activity that uses the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@. For lifecycle management to work correctly the activity must call its parent's @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@.

A non-negative identifier for this client. At any given time, only one auto-managed client is allowed per id. To reuse an id you must first call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#stopAutoManage_E@ on the previous client.

Called if the connection failed and there was no resolution or the user chose not to complete the provided resolution. If this listener is called, the client will no longer be auto-managed, and a new instance must be built. In the event that the user chooses not to complete a resolution, the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#ConnectionResult_E@ will have a status code of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#ConnectionResult#CANCELED_E@.
Throws: if clientId is already being auto-managed.
enableAutoManage(android.support.v4.app..Description: Enables automatic lifecycle management in a support library @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentActivity_E@ that connects the client in @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentActivity#onStart_E@ and disconnects it in @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentActivity#onStop_E@. It handles user recoverable errors appropriately and calls if the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#ConnectionResult_E@ has no resolution. This eliminates most of the boiler plate associated with using @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@. When using this option, @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#Builder#build_E@ must be called from the main thread.
enableAutoManage(android.support.v4.app..FullName: public GoogleApiClient.Builder enableAutoManage (FragmentActivity fragmentActivity, int clientId, GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener unresolvedConnectionFailedListener)

Parameters: the 3rd party server client ID for offline access.
the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ServerAuthCodeCallbacks_E@ delegate which will be called back when communicating back to 3rd party web server is needed.
requestServerAuthCode(java.lang.String,.Description: Specifies requesting of a server auth code for third party web server as part of client connect() flow. This is useful for applications which have a web server component that need to access a Google API after the user has left the (Android) application. If server auth code is requested, you will be given the server auth code in @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ServerAuthCodeCallbacks#onUploadServerAuthCode_E@ callback.
requestServerAuthCode(java.lang.String,.FullName: public GoogleApiClient.Builder requestServerAuthCode (String serverClientId, GoogleApiClient.ServerAuthCodeCallbacks callbacks)

Parameters: the listener where the results of the asynchronous @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ call are delivered.
addConnectionCallbacks(com.google.androi.Description: Registers a listener to receive connection events from this GoogleApiClient. Applications should balance calls to this method with calls to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#unregisterConnectionCallbacks_E@ to avoid leaking resources. If the specified listener is already registered to receive connection events, this method will not add a duplicate entry for the same listener. Note that the order of messages received here may not be stable, so clients should not rely on the order that multiple listeners receive events in.
